page.title: 06A Day In Sharon's Life
page.content: I got up at 8.00 a.m. Lyndsey came to call for me at 8.50 and we set off for school. The first lesson after service was hymn practice until 10.00 and then we did Ginn Activity work until playtime. There are 27 children in my class, aged either 10 or 11. After playtime we did some work for the Domesday Project. We drew a plan of our classroom until dinner-time. I stayed at school and ate my packed lunch which was sandwiches, apple and a drink. Some children have school dinners costing 51p. At about 1.15 we came in to do some S.M.P. Maths and then we watched a T.V programme called Computers at Work. School finishes at 3.30. In the evening I played hide and seek, went to Swimming Club and watched television.
